## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've heard that Verus allows users to create their own tokens and blockchains. Can you tell me more about that?

**AI Assistant:**
On the Verus network, any user with an ID can create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can interact with the Verus chain. This blockchain can be 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant, and can send and receive from the Verus chain. This gives users a lot of flexibility and control over their own blockchain and token ecosystem.

**User:**
That sounds really powerful. What's the advantage of creating a PBaaS chain on the Verus network?

**AI Assistant:**
Creating a PBaaS chain on the Verus network allows projects to start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network. Additionally, projects can join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. This can save a lot of time and resources compared to building a blockchain from scratch.

**User:**
I've also heard about DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets on the Verus network. Can you explain what those are?

**AI Assistant:**
On the Verus network, any ID owner can define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This allows for a high degree of flexibility and customization in DeFi applications.

**User:**
I've heard that DeFi liquidity pools can also address some of the problems with miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running. Can you explain how that works?

**AI Assistant:**
DeFi liquidity pools on the Verus network address the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running by ensuring that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This provides fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities. This can help prevent MEV and front-running, which can be major issues in DeFi.

**User:**
Finally, what's unique about launching a new blockchain on the Verus network?

**AI Assistant:**
On the Verus network, launching a new blockchain is accompanied by the simultaneous launch of a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. This bridge converter currency has the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset-backed or partially asset-backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain. This allows for seamless interaction between the new blockchain and the Verus network, and provides a lot of flexibility and customization options for projects launching new blockchains.

What kind of decentralized tokens and blockchains can be created on the Verus network?

On the Verus network, any user with an ID can create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can interact with the Verus chain. This blockchain can be 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant, and can send and receive from the Verus chain.

nted on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
- Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockcha
